Title: ML Engineer - Speech (m/f/d)
Description:
🎤 Why voize? Because we’re more than just a job!

At voize, we’re revolutionizing the healthcare industry with AI: Nurses simply speak their documentation into their smartphones, and our AI automatically generates the correct entries. This saves each nurse an average of 39 minutes per day, improves the quality of documentation, and makes their daily work much more rewarding.

voize is YCombinator-funded, already in use at over 600 senior care homes, and has grown by 100% in the last 90 days. Our customers save over 3.5 million hours annually – time spent on people instead of paperwork.

But this is just the beginning. With our self-developed voize AI, we’re transforming not only the healthcare industry, but also have the potential to create value in many other sectors – from healthcare to inspections.

💡 Your Mission

If you're a Machine Learning Engineer experienced with Speech recognition and are excited to work at the cutting edge of product design, applied ML research, and MLOps, then go ahead and apply! With us, you'll build products with direct user feedback, train AI models with real data, and ship new features to production every day.

🤝 Your Skillset – What You Bring To The Table


Several years hands-on experience in Deep Learning for speech recognition, including developing and optimising ASR-systems (not just academic research)
Excellent foundation in STT (Speech-to-Text) system development with a focus on real-world applications
Experience with owning the ML process end-to-end: from concept and exploration, to model productionization, maintenance, monitoring and optimization
Shipped ML models to production with Python and PyTorch
Trained new models from scratch and not just fine-tuning existing ones


🚀 Your Daily Business – No two days are alike


Take ownership for the design, training, evaluation, and deployment of our deep learning models in the space of speech recognition
The models you build and refine are at the heart of our applications and directly impact the end-user
You'll get to engineer large self-supervised trainings as well as fast inference for mobile devices and hosted environments


🎯 Our Success Mindset – How we work at voize


Resilience is one of your strengths – you see challenges as opportunities, not obstacles
Iterative working suits you – you test, learn, and improve constantly instead of waiting for perfection
Communication & feedback come naturally to you – you openly address issues and both give and receive constructive feedback


🌱 Growing together – what you can expect at voize


We are a fast-growing startup, that means you will tackle challenges, grow quickly, and make a real impact, giving healthcare professionals more time for real patient care
We foster an open, collaborative culture with regular team events, whether you work from our Berlin office or remotely from Germany
Become a co-creator of our success with stock options
Generous perks: 30 vacation days plus your birthday off, Germany Transport Ticket, Urban Sports Club, regular company off-sites, and access to learning platforms such as Blinkist and Audible
You decide when you work best, that means flexible working hours and a good hybrid set-up.


✨ Ready to talk? Apply now! 🚀

We look forward to your application and can’t wait to meet you – no matter who you are or what background you have!
Show more
HTML:
🎤 Why voize? Because we’re more than just a job!

At voize, we’re revolutionizing the healthcare industry with AI: Nurses simply speak their documentation into their smartphones, and our AI automatically generates the correct entries. This saves each nurse an average of 39 minutes per day, improves the quality of documentation, and makes their daily work much more rewarding.

voize is YCombinator-funded, already in use at over 600 senior care homes, and has grown by 100% in the last 90 days. Our customers save over 3.5 million hours annually – time spent on people instead of paperwork.

But this is just the beginning. With our self-developed voize AI, we’re transforming not only the healthcare industry, but also have the potential to create value in many other sectors – from healthcare to inspections.

💡 Your Mission

If you're a Machine Learning Engineer experienced with Speech recognition and are excited to work at the cutting edge of product design, applied ML research, and MLOps, then go ahead and apply! With us, you'll build products with direct user feedback, train AI models with real data, and ship new features to production every day.

🤝 Your Skillset – What You Bring To The Table

  • Several years hands-on experience in Deep Learning for speech recognition, including developing and optimising ASR-systems (not just academic research)
  • Excellent foundation in STT (Speech-to-Text) system development with a focus on real-world applications
  • Experience with owning the ML process end-to-end: from concept and exploration, to model productionization, maintenance, monitoring and optimization
  • Shipped ML models to production with Python and PyTorch
  • Trained new models from scratch and not just fine-tuning existing ones

🚀 Your Daily Business – No two days are alike

  • Take ownership for the design, training, evaluation, and deployment of our deep learning models in the space of speech recognition
  • The models you build and refine are at the heart of our applications and directly impact the end-user
  • You'll get to engineer large self-supervised trainings as well as fast inference for mobile devices and hosted environments

🎯 Our Success Mindset – How we work at voize

  • Resilience is one of your strengths – you see challenges as opportunities, not obstacles
  • Iterative working suits you – you test, learn, and improve constantly instead of waiting for perfection
  • Communication & feedback come naturally to you – you openly address issues and both give and receive constructive feedback

🌱 Growing together – what you can expect at voize

  • We are a fast-growing startup, that means you will tackle challenges, grow quickly, and make a real impact, giving healthcare professionals more time for real patient care
  • We foster an open, collaborative culture with regular team events, whether you work from our Berlin office or remotely from Germany
  • Become a co-creator of our success with stock options
  • Generous perks: 30 vacation days plus your birthday off, Germany Transport Ticket, Urban Sports Club, regular company off-sites, and access to learning platforms such as Blinkist and Audible
  • You decide when you work best, that means flexible working hours and a good hybrid set-up.

✨ Ready to talk? Apply now! 🚀

We look forward to your application and can’t wait to meet you – no matter who you are or what background you have!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer – Generative AI & LLMs (m/w/d) - Home Office möglich
Description:
Deine Mission bei uns:

Als Machine Learning Engineer bei Cito.ai arbeitest du daran, unser AI-System Cera in die Realität zu bringen: einen intelligenten KI-Agenten, der Logistikprozesse neu denkt und Transporte für Unternehmen deutlich effizienter steuert.

Du kombinierst dein Machine-Learning-Know-how mit neuesten Methoden im Bereich Generative AI und entwickelst smarte Anwendungen rund um LLMs wie GPT-4, Claude oder Mistral.

Dein Job ist es, AI-Prototypen in produktive Lösungen zu überführen – von der Datenlogik über Prompts bis zur Integration in reale Workflows.

Damit passt du zu uns:


Erfahrung im Machine Learning oder Natural Language Processing, idealerweise mit Fokus auf LLMs.
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python und JavaScript.
Verständnis für Prompt Engineering und logisches Sprachdesign.
Optional: Erfahrung mit LangChain, OpenAI APIs, Pinecone oder Vectorstores.
Pragmatismus, Eigeninitiative und Freude daran, AI-Lösungen praxisnah zu entwickeln.
Deutsch mindestens auf C1-Niveau


Darauf kannst du dich freuen:


Entwicklung und Optimierung von LLM-gestützten Anwendungen für reale Business-Cases.
Aufbau und Automatisierung strukturierter Tests, um AI-Antworten systematisch zu verbessern.
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit unserem Development-Team, um robuste Lösungen zu schaffen.
Mitgestaltung von AI-Use-Cases – vom ersten Prototyp bis zum produktiven Einsatz.
Optional: Dokumentation von Best Practices im Umgang mit LLMs.


Über uns

Wir sind Cito, die digitale Transport as a Service Lösung der Volkswagen Nutzfahrzeuge. Unsere Mission: den zeitkritischen Transportmarkt zu transformieren und Einfachheit, Transparenz und Fairness im Markt zu schaffen. Unsere Herzstück: Eine effiziente, digitale Softwareplatform für Versender und Transporteure.

Unser Team: unser größtes Gut.

Wir glauben an offene Kommunikation und ehrliche Beziehungen, sowohl innerhalb unseres Teams als auch mit unseren Partnern und Kunden. Fairness und Transparenz sind die Grundpfeiler, auf denen wir unser Geschäft aufbauen und pflegen.

Außerdem sind fest davon überzeugt, dass das Wachstum unseres Unternehmens Hand in Hand mit der Entwicklung unserer Mitarbeiter geht. Cito bietet ein dynamisches, unterstützendes Umfeld, in dem Sie Ihre Fähigkeiten erweitern, neue Ideen einbringen und Ihre Karriere vorantreiben können.

Wir suchen nach Talenten, die bereit sind, Herausforderungen anzunehmen, die Initiative zu ergreifen und gemeinsam mit uns die Zukunft des Transports zu gestalten.
Show more

Title: AI Researcher - 100% onsite
Description:
AI Researcher - 100% onsite




We’re looking for an exceptional AI Researcher to help shape the next generation of AI-driven recommendation systems. You’ll be building, training, and deploying advanced ML and NLP models to power world-class search recommendations used by thousands of users worldwide.




This is 100% onsite role located in Berlin, Germany




You’ll work alongside talented engineers, sales specialists, and marketing teams to truly understand user intent, then translate that into AI-powered solutions that make a real impact.




We’re not interested in degrees or years of experience, we're looking for excellence.

Whether you’ve published at a top-tier AI conference, built a side project to thousands of users, contributed to cutting-edge open-source libraries, or solved complex real-world problems, we want to hear from you.




Please note - this is NOT a 9-5 role - you will be expected to work evenings, and sometimes weekends (which can typically be worked remotely)

Our client is building a unicorn and is seeking dedicated and motivated people to come along for the ride.




What's in it for you?

Excellent base plus equity
Free gym membership
Food covered when working late
Free travel home after 21:00
All the latest tech including MacBook pro, Apple Studio Displays etc.




Your tech stack could include:

Python (ML/NLP ecosystem) and TypeScript
Libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, HuggingFace, PyTorch, TensorFlow
Cloud environments like GCP and Vertex AI
Familiarity with AI models such as OpenAI, Claude, LLaMA, Gemini




You might be a great fit if you:

Have designed and deployed NLP or computer vision models from scratch
Thrive in fast-paced, high-impact environments
Have demonstrated elite skill in your field (academia, competitions, industry)




Bonus points for:

Open-source contributions
Side projects in production
Conference publications
Startup or founder experience




If you can produce exceptional work quickly and thrive when challenged, this could be for you.




If this sounds interesting and you'd like to learn more, click the link below to apply or email me with a copy of your CV on smouland@eu-recruit.com




By applying to this role you understand that we may collect your personal data and store and process it on our systems. For more information please see our Privacy Notice (https://eu-recruit.com/about-us/privacy-notice/)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer (m/w/d)

Arbeitsmodell: Hybrid (Berlin + Remote)

Gehalt: 90.000 € – 120.000 € p.a. (je nach Erfahrung und Qualifikation)




Über unseren Kunden

Unser Kunde ist ein innovatives Technologieunternehmen mit Sitz in Berlin, das datengetriebene Produkte und KI-Lösungen entwickelt, die weit über Standardanwendungen hinausgehen. Hier erwartet dich ein Umfeld, in dem technische Exzellenz und Innovation Hand in Hand gehen – mit modernster Infrastruktur und Projekten, die echten Impact haben.




Deine Aufgaben

Du entwickelst, trainierst und optimierst komplexe Machine-Learning-Modelle (z. B. Deep Learning, NLP, Recommender Systems, generative Modelle).
Du setzt modernste Frameworks und Tools (u. a. PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX, Hugging Face Transformers, MLflow) in produktiven Umgebungen ein.
Du baust robuste ML-Pipelines auf und skalierst sie gemeinsam mit Data-Engineering- und MLOps-Teams (u. a. mit Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow, Spark).
Du arbeitest in einer Cloud-Umgebung (AWS, GCP oder Azure) und implementierst CI/CD-Workflows.
Du evaluierst kontinuierlich neue Forschungsansätze (z. B. Self-Supervised Learning, Foundation Models) und bringst sie in produktive Systeme.




Dein Profil

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder einem vergleichbaren Bereich; Promotion ist ein Plus, aber kein Muss.
Mindestens 3 Jahre praktische Erfahrung im Machine-Learning-Umfeld, idealerweise 5+ Jahre.
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python und im Umgang mit gängigen ML-Frameworks (PyTorch oder TensorFlow).
Erfahrung mit Cloud-Umgebungen (AWS, GCP oder Azure) und Containern (Docker, Kubernetes).
Praxis im Bereich MLOps und im Aufbau skalierbarer Pipelines.
Analytische Stärke, konzeptionelles Denken und die Fähigkeit, komplexe Probleme in robuste Lösungen zu übersetzen.
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse (mind. C1) und fließendes Englisch.




Das bietet dir unser Kunde

Ein attraktives Gehaltspaket im oberen Marktsegment.
Ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell mit flexibler Home-Office-Regelung.
Zugang zu hochperformanten GPU-Clustern und einer modernen Data-Infrastruktur.
Flache Hierarchien, kurze Entscheidungswege und eine innovationsgetriebene Kultur.
Budget für Konferenzen, Weiterbildungen und Publikationen.
Ein internationales Team mit hoher Expertise und starkem Zusammenhalt.







Du bist interessiert? Dann melde dich gerne bei mir:

Constantin Clodius

Mobil: +49 1703660753

E-Mail: c.clodius@zabelglobal.com

Show more

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d) (Analytics & Dashboarding) im Consulting
Description:
Beschreibung

Als Data Scientist (m/w/d) – Analytics & Dashboards übernimmst du die Full-Stack-Verantwortung für den gesamten Datenwertschöpfungsprozess – von der Datenabfrage aus dem Datalake bis hin zur Konzeption und Umsetzung interaktiver Dashboards für das Management.

Deine Aufgaben


Du analysierst komplexe und heterogene Datenstrukturen, dokumentierst und harmonisierst Quellen und führst sie effizient zusammen.
Gemeinsam mit deinem Team baust und betreibst du skalierbare Datenpipelines zwischen Cloud-Quellen und Dashboard-Tools – inklusive Automatisierung, Qualitätssicherung und Performance-Tuning (v. a. via SQL).
Du konzipierst intuitive Dashboards mit hoher Usability und Storytelling-Ansatz und setzt diese in Tools wie AWS QuickSight , Tableau oder Power BI um.
Du führst Ad-hoc-Analysen und Prototypen und präsentierst Ergebnisse klar , prägnant und adressatengerecht.
Du übernimmst Leadership-Aufgaben, strukturierst dein Team, planst Sprints und stellst durch Reviews und Abnahmen die Qualität sicher.
Als technischer Sparringspartner unterstützt du die Projektleitung bei Architektur fragen , Risik o bewertungen , Priorisierung en und treibst innovative Initiativen aktiv voran.
Im engen Austausch mit Fachbereichen, IT, Data Engineers und Management bringst du deine Expertise ein und bist eine verbindliche Ansprechperson.


Dein Profil


Du b eherrschst SQL souverän (inkl. Queries , Joins , Window Functions , Performance-Optimierung).
Du hast Erfahrung im Aufbau von Cloud-zu-Dashboard-Pipelines sowie in der Daten aufbereitung und - restrukturierung.
Dashboarding ist deine Stärke – du bringst Erfahrung im UX-Design, in Interaktivität und Lesbarkeit mit und bist sicher im Umgang mit AWS QuickSight , Power BI und idealerweise Tableau .
Du denkst konzeptionell „zu Ende“ , arbeitest zuverlässig auch unter Zeitdruck und lieferst belastbare Ergebnisse.
Idealerweise kennst du Prozesse in der Automobilindustrie, insbesondere Entwicklungs-, Produk tions-, Defect -, Änderungs- und Anlaufmanagement-Prozesse.
D eine Reisebereitschaft ermöglicht es dir , unserem Kunden in München als Ansprechpartner zur Seite zu stehen.


Unser Angebot an dich

Bei DRIVE Consulting Triffst Du Auf Ein Junges Team, Dessen Herz Für Technische Beratungsprojekte Und Die Automotive-Branche Schlägt. Offenheit, Vertrauen Und Teamspirit Sind Uns Wichtig, Damit Wir Gemeinsam Innovative Lösungen Für Die Mobilität Von Morgen Finden. Das Erwartet Dich


Ein schnelles Wachstum und die Chance, dabei maßgeblich mitzuwirken
Eine steile Lernkurve und Förderung deiner persönlichen Weiterentwicklung
Herausragende Teamevents, denn Spaß bei der Arbeit ist uns wichtig
Monatliches Happy Friday Frühstück
Ein Dienstwagen, der zu dir passt
6 Euro Lunch-Zuschuss täglich
Obst, Kaffee & Erfrischungsgetränke for free
100 Euro Spendenbudget und du entscheidest wofür
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Sabbatical,...


Über uns

DRIVE Consulting GmbH ist eine Unternehmensberatung mit Hauptsitz in Aachen sowie Standorten in München, Berlin, Peking und Shanghai. Unser Herz schlägt für technische Beratungsprojekte im automobilen Umfeld. Sowohl deutsche Premium OEMs als auch junge, aufstrebende Automobilhersteller gehören zu unseren Kunden.

Im Juni 2022 haben wir unseren alten Namen StreetScooter Research verabschiedet und haben mit DRIVE Consulting nun endlich einen Namen, der perfekt zu uns passt. Er steht für unseren Fokus auf die Mobilitätsbranche und repräsentiert gleichzeitig unseren Spirit - denn wir sind ein Team, in dem jede*r Einzelne DRIVE hat.

Wir stehen unseren Kunden als Wegbereiter ins Unbekannte, als Katalysator für Innovationen zur Seite. Denn wir sind uns sicher, dass man nur mit dem Mut, unbekannte Wege einzuschlagen, einzigartige Erfolgsgeschichten schreiben kann.

Wir schlagen Brücken zwischen kleinen Ideenschmieden und großen Konzernen, zwischen Management und Technologieexperten.

Durch unseren engen und partnerschaftlichen Austausch mit unseren Kunden können wir maßgeschneiderte und individuelle Lösungen anbieten. Ausschlaggebend für unseren Erfolg ist zudem unser einzigartiges Partnernetzwerk aus Industrie und Forschung. Durch die Nähe zu namenhaften Universitäten, wie der RWTH Aachen, vereinen wir Wissenschaft und Praxis.

Begeisterung wird bei uns großgeschrieben und bestimmt unseren Arbeitsalltag, weil sie der beste Antrieb ist!
Show more

  • Obst, Kaffee & Erfrischungsgetränke for free
  • 100 Euro Spendenbudget und du entscheidest wofür
  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Sabbatical,...

Über uns

DRIVE Consulting GmbH ist eine Unternehmensberatung mit Hauptsitz in Aachen sowie Standorten in München, Berlin, Peking und Shanghai. Unser Herz schlägt für technische Beratungsprojekte im automobilen Umfeld. Sowohl deutsche Premium OEMs als auch junge, aufstrebende Automobilhersteller gehören zu unseren Kunden.

Im Juni 2022 haben wir unseren alten Namen StreetScooter Research verabschiedet und haben mit DRIVE Consulting nun endlich einen Namen, der perfekt zu uns passt. Er steht für unseren Fokus auf die Mobilitätsbranche und repräsentiert gleichzeitig unseren Spirit - denn wir sind ein Team, in dem jede*r Einzelne DRIVE hat.

Wir stehen unseren Kunden als Wegbereiter ins Unbekannte, als Katalysator für Innovationen zur Seite. Denn wir sind uns sicher, dass man nur mit dem Mut, unbekannte Wege einzuschlagen, einzigartige Erfolgsgeschichten schreiben kann.

Wir schlagen Brücken zwischen kleinen Ideenschmieden und großen Konzernen, zwischen Management und Technologieexperten.

Durch unseren engen und partnerschaftlichen Austausch mit unseren Kunden können wir maßgeschneiderte und individuelle Lösungen anbieten. Ausschlaggebend für unseren Erfolg ist zudem unser einzigartiges Partnernetzwerk aus Industrie und Forschung. Durch die Nähe zu namenhaften Universitäten, wie der RWTH Aachen, vereinen wir Wissenschaft und Praxis.

Begeisterung wird bei uns großgeschrieben und bestimmt unseren Arbeitsalltag, weil sie der beste Antrieb ist!

Title: AI Researcher - NLP / Computer Vision / Training / ML Models
Description:
AI Researcher - NLP / Computer Vision / Training / ML Models - Expanding High Growth Startup




Are you looking to join a dynamic team to help scale up one of the fastest growing startup companies that specialise in AI Search?




We're working with a fast growing company with big growth plans and we're looking for someone who is really committed to helping the company grow and building great products.




This is not a 9-5 job. However, if you want to be a part of an elite team, that already has top tier investors and with plans to become a Unicorn company, this is it.




This position is a full-time position based on-site in Berlin. You will be expected to work longer hours and we're looking for high peforming and committed individuals.




Salaries are between €90,000-€150,000 base + equity.




Other perks include free gym, free food from uber eats in the evenings, free uber home after 9pm and they will also often go out for lunch as a team at the companies expense.




For this AI Researcher position, I'm interested in speaking to people with the following:




- Any degree is fine

- There is no specific experience level requirement but we are looking for high performers and evidence of this on your CV. Work ethic is the most important and we want people that want to build something extraordinary.

- Experience with Python and AI libraries such as Tensorflow and Pytorch




I welcome your application if you'd like to find out more and if you know someone it would suit, we offer a fantastic referral scheme which I would be happy to discuss.




Keywords:




Research / R&D / NLP / Computer Vision / Information Retrieval / LLM / RAG / NLP / Machine Learning / Tensorflow / Pytorch / Huggingface / OpenAI / Gemini / Llama




#researchengineer #AIresearch




By applying to this role you understand that we may collect your personal data and store and process it on our systems. For more information please see our Privacy Notice (https://eu-recruit.com/about-us/privacy-notice/)

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - NLP (m/f/d)
Description:
What we do




Merantix Momentum is a Berlin-based AI startup focusing on accelerating AI adoption across many industries through B2B solutions, as well as publicly funded research projects. We work across several domains, including manufacturing, healthcare, the German public sector, and many more, transforming businesses as an external machine learning department. We achieve this using our core expertise in state-of-the-art machine learning combined with our culture of rapid iterations to build scalable solutions.


Tasks


Your role




Are you passionate about developing impactful applications of Machine Learning? The mission of this role is to bring state-of-the-art deep-learning methods to real-world applications from ideation and prototyping to production.




These will be your main responsibilities:




● Leading major projects




● Scope machine learning projects and their technical feasibility through client interaction




● Contribute to the next generation AI stack and grow the open source ecosystem




● Collaborate with data-, backend-, and frontend engineers in order to build production-ready AI solutions




●Implement machine learning methods and apply them to real-world use cases


Requirements


Your profile




The ideal candidate is proficient in software engineering and the latest machine- and deep-learning technologies, while also having a solid understanding of machine learning theory and fundamentals. You will independently scope, plan, manage, and drive machine learning projects from the ideation to the production phase - with a particular focus on Natural Language Processing.




You are a great fit for our team if this describes you:




● MSc/PhD in computer science, machine learning, or related technical field




● Relevant programming skills in Python and experience with libraries like PyTorch




● Deep understanding of machine learning principles with hands-on experience training and fine-tuning neural networks




● Appreciation for sound engineering practices like version control, clean code, code review, testing, CI/CD, and automation.




● Ability to interact with clients, to understand their problems, and to design as well as to explain complex technical solutions




● Fluency in English and German


Benefits


What we offer




Why Join Merantix Momentum?





Engaging Topics and Excellence: Gain unique insights into applied machine learning research and development while working with a team of talented engineers and entrepreneurs;


Growth Opportunities: As a rapidly growing startup, you'll find exciting career development prospects within Merantix Momentum;


International Team: Join our dynamic, international team committed to making an impact;


Learning and Development: Benefit from an annual budget for conferences and educational resources, as well as weekly and monthly AI-related events;


Flexible and Open Work Culture: Enjoy a flat hierarchy, open feedback, and flexibility in work-from-home policies and working hours;


AI Ethics: Contribute to the development of ethical AI software and engage in open discussions on this topic within our team;


State-of-the-Art Workspace: Work in our bright, open office situated on the AI Campus in Berlin;


Hardware Support: Receive the necessary equipment to excel in your role.


Employee Benefits: Choose from mobility and transportation, sports club membership, or grocery allowances to suit your lifestyle.





About us




We are an equal-opportunit employer and value diversity. We consider all applications equally regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity. We strongly encourage individuals from groups traditionally underrepresented in tech to apply, and we can help with immigration.

Title: Staff Machine Learning Research Scientist (d/f/m)
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity – without access to high-quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That's where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charité), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Staff Machine Learning Research Scientist at Aignostics, you will play a crucial role in shaping the scientific and technical direction and integrity of our data science platform, projects, and products. You will work hand in hand with our collaborators in academia and industry to push the state of the art for digital pathology. Your expertise will be instrumental in driving scientific and technical excellence across all data science teams, ensuring we deliver high-quality, scalable solutions that transform complex biomedical data into actionable insights for cancer research and diagnostics..

This is a unique opportunity to join a fun, diverse, and growing team of 100+ machine learners, software engineers, applied scientists, pathologists, and biologists to shape the next generation of cancer treatments. You will be part of a driven community that works in an agile, supportive, and interdisciplinary research environment where your results make a difference to patients. In our established startup, you have the opportunity to grow personally and technically, take on significant responsibilities, and benefit from a dynamic work environment.

Data Science or Machine Learning? We do both at Aignostics, and are convinced that both are needed for success. You can expect to work on a broad spectrum of topics from deep learning with foundation and other state-of-the-art models on terabytes of data to projects in low sample regimes and very high-dimensional and multimodal data. We have nearly all the data science challenges you can think of for you!

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


You identify promising new directions based on the scientific literature, results from in-house experiments, and your own novel ideas.
You are able to turn these ideas into reality by describing, presenting, designing, implementing, and experimenting with novel machine learning architectures, models, and variants of existing models
You analyze experiments that you and others run, and form ideas and hypotheses to explain results
You run large-scale distributed machine learning experiments
You work with the Staff Data Science team and with other teams involved in machine learning and translational research
You resolve technical difficulties that arise as part of the data science and machine learning work
You develop ideas about our data science and machine learning strategy, and how this relates to business objectives, so as to provide a competitive advantage
You develop ideas about product management on technical and scientific feasibility and risks of complex product features
You contribute to technical and scientific design, planning, and integration of our platform across systems and algorithms
You provide technical and scientific guidance in data science model, algorithm, and system design reviews
Educate mid-level and junior ML researchers and data scientists to bring them up to the next level
Demonstrate long-term thinking and utmost technical and scientific excellence in your individual contributions
Support data science teams in maintaining up-to-date, high-quality documentation and code


What We Are Looking For


Demonstrated research excellence, as demonstrated by your scientific track record: peer-reviewed publications in relevant journals and at relevant conferences
Proven track record of driving technical and scientific excellence and innovation
Expertise in: pathology machine learning, foundation models, and robust medical machine learning models
Deep understanding of what it means and takes to apply machine learning in the medical domain
Extensive knowledge and understanding of relevant deep learning models
Knowledge of the medical and/or biological domain is a highly valuable additional qualification
Excellent communicative skills, able to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
You are a team player who gets enthusiastic when your contributions drive the team ahead
Extensive experience with designing, setting up, running, monitoring and evaluating (i) large-scale distributed machine learning trainings, (ii) multimodal machine learning, or (iii) robust machine learning products; 6+ years of experience with this
Advanced degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field that provides sufficient technical background to perform state of the art machine learning research
Extensive experience with machine learning and statistical concepts, including advanced topics such as self-supervised learning, foundation models, representation learning, explainable AI (XAI), multimodal models
Knowledge and routine application of best practices in software engineering, software architecture, and clean coding
Solid understanding of cloud technologies (GCP, AWS), containerization and orchestration (Kubernetes, Ray)


Ideally, you also:


Contribute to open-source projects and scientific publications
Have experience with large scale data processing systems such as Ray, Spark, etc.
Extensive expertise in multiple programming languages and frameworks is a plus
Worked in a regulated environment, e.g. financial services, aerospace, or healthcare
Have knowledge of digital pathology or medical imaging
Have experience with biomedical data processing and analysis


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing, and you are encouraged to apply if you have a strong combination of these skills.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven startup: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charité, LMU Munich, TU Berlin, and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse, and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take significant responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000€ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, where you'll learn from and mentor great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off with 28 paid vacation days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports, and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


Join us to make a difference in the fight against cancer!

About Us

aignostics.com

Title: Sports Scientist (m/f/x)
Description:
We are currently seeking a highly motivated and passionate individual who is committed to enhancing performance and wellbeing of our clients though data driven guidance. HAGIUS is pleased to offer an exceptional opportunity for a Sport Scientist (m/f/x) to join our dedicated team. With our small team, we provide a unique environment where every contribution is valued, yet our scale is sufficient to have a meaningful impact within the Wellness and Fitness industry.




The ideal candidate will possess a strong desire to assist our clients in achieving their fitness and wellness objectives. If you excel in a dynamic, supportive atmosphere and are keen on collaborating with a team equally committed to health and wellbeing, we invite you to apply.


Tasks



Working in and as part of a team of experts


Conducting personal training sessions and classes


Creating and performing physical assessments (using tools like force plates)


Assessing mental and emotional wellbeing


Analyzing assessment data and setting goals with clients


Creating training plans, schedules, recommendations based on data


Guiding clients through their journey at Hagius


Observing the progress made by clients


Gathering feedback from clients and trainers.


Fine-tune plans depending on progress and assessment data


Ensuring flow of information to the necessary team members



Requirements



Interest in the tasks above


Passion for data-driven fitness guidance


Ability to work as a team player in a team of experts


High-quality education in sports science (University Degree or comparable education)


at least one year work experience in the field of data driven training



Benefits



being part of a passionate team that's striving for honest training with high quality


free participation in classes and usage of facilities





We are looking forward to your application.

Title: Optimization Research Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
YOUR TASKS


Develop state-of-the-art optimization solvers for the steel industry
Understand and analyse the complex business logic, constraints and objectives of our customers
Translate the business logic into high-performance algorithms and mathematical optimization models
Validate the performance and quality of your models by proper test- and benchmarks sets
Manage and maintain the embedded role of the solver in a broader, modern backend architecture
Explain and document your approaches and ideas to the team


YOUR PROFILE


Experience in developing solutions for difficult combinatorial optimization problems from the industry
Strong background in Mixed-Integer Programming (MIP), Linear Programming (LP) and combinatorial optimization algorithms
Ability to build MIP models for real-world problems
Experience in using optimization solving software like: Gurobi, Xpress, SCIP, HiGHS, CBC ...
Strong C++ background (preferably C++20 or higher)
Ability to explain complex concepts to your team
Experience working in agile environments, containers and CI/CD concepts
English is required, Fluency in German is a plus


Benefits


Transparency of business strategies
Working in our Berlin Office (incl. 2 Home Office days/week)
Autonomy balanced by responsibility
Cohesive, multidisciplinary team
Meaningful industrial problems
Modern machine learning techniques
Sleek, new office located in Berlin
Professional educational opportunities
German language courses and public transport included


About Us

Smart Steel Technologies supplies ready-to-use artificial intelligence software products for process optimization in steel mills that lead to improved quality, reduction of energy cost and improvement of CO2 efficiency. The machine learning and data science we employ comes in several varieties: image processing, signal processing, classical supervised modeling, unsupervised methods, and fundamental statistics and probability. We are hiring talented experts across disciplines to join our team and help us to further develop our industry leading solutions. Did you know that steel is the most recycled material worldwide?

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are proud to be working alongside a leading financial services company headquartered in Berlin, who is driving innovation at the intersection of finance and advanced AI. As they continue to scale next-generation AI capabilities, we are seeking a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to spearhead initiatives in Generative AI and Agentic AI, working alongside a highly skilled and experienced team of AI professionals.




What You'll Do:

Work closely with a team of 4 ML Engineers focused on building and deploying cutting-edge GenAI and agentic systems.
Work closely with our Head of Data Science to align technical strategy with business goals.
Architect and deliver robust, scalable ML solutions in production environments.
Develop and fine-tune LLMs, agentic frameworks, and intelligent systems tailored to complex financial workflows.
Ensure best practices in MLOps, experimentation, and evaluation across the team.
Collaborate across departments (Product, Engineering, Compliance) to drive impactful AI solutions.




Requirements:

Fluency in German (C1 level or above) – essential for cross-functional collaboration.
Based in Berlin or willing to relocate.
5+ years of experience in machine learning, with recent focus on Generative AI, LLMs, or Agentic AI architectures.
Strong coding skills in Python, experience with frameworks such as LangChain, Transformers, PyTorch, or Ray.
Experience working on GenAI initiatives from PoC through to production.




What We Offer:

A pivotal leadership role in a mission-critical AI division.
A collaborative environment with senior GenAI experts and continuous learning opportunities.
Competitive salary and benefits tailored to your experience.
Modern offices in central Berlin, with a flexible hybrid working model.




Ready to lead the future of AI?

Apply now and become part of a company where your expertise will shape tomorrow’s intelligent financial systems.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Trinetix is looking for a skilled Python Developer.

You will be working in a direction that is primarily focused on high-tech developments for the US client in the consulting and financial domains. All projects are aimed at optimizing business processes, ensuring maximum efficiency in work, and helping the client to automate and improve their internal processes. Our team specializes in the use of advanced technologies and, at certain stages of project development, actively utilizes the latest advances in artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML).

Requirements


5+ years of experience in software development using Python.
Hands-on experience with AWS services or Azure Cloud Platform
Familiarity with ETL processes and data transformation.
Strong knowledge of web services, API development, and RESTful APIs.
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Knowledge of frameworks and libraries such as Pandas, FastAPI, etc.
Upper-Intermediate or higher level of English.


Nice-to-haves


Understanding of AI concepts, NLP, and LLM.
Experience working with other AI and NLP technologies, such as OpenAI's GPT models family.
Knowledge of containerization and orchestration technologies, such as Docker and Kubernetes.
Familiarity with agile development methodologies, such as Scrum or Kanban.


Core Responsibilities


Develop and maintain applications using Python, with a focus on integrating AI/LLM, AWS /Azure services.
Design, build, and deploy machine learning models.
Implement ETL processes using AWS GlueJobs/Azure Functions to process and transform data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features and enhancements.
Optimize applications for maximum performance, scalability, and maintainability.
Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve software defects and issues.
Keep up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies to ensure the software is current and competitive.
Provide technical guidance and support to other team members.
Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.
Participate in code reviews and contribute to improving code quality.


Expected Qualifications


Build and deliver complex features with confidence You take ownership of major parts of a project, building advanced features that meet both technical and business needs.
Make smart technical decisions and contribute to design discussions You can design and implement solutions independently, and you help shape system architecture to support scalability and long-term goals.
Support and mentor junior developers You share your experience with less-experienced teammates, offering guidance on code quality, design choices, and development best practices.


What We Offer


Continuous learning and career growth opportunities
Professional training and English/Spanish language classes
Comprehensive medical insurance
Mental health support
Specialized benefits program with compensation for fitness activities, hobbies, pet care, and more
Flexible working hours
Inclusive and supportive culture


About Us

Established in 2011, Trinetix is a dynamic tech service provider supporting enterprise clients around the world.

Headquartered in Nashville, Tennessee, we have a global team of over 1,000 professionals and delivery centers across Europe, the United States, and Argentina. We partner with leading global brands, delivering innovative digital solutions across Fintech, Professional Services, Logistics, Healthcare, and Agriculture.

Our operations are driven by a strong business vision, a people-first culture, and a commitment to responsible growth. We actively give back to the community through various CSR activities and adhere to international principles for sustainable development and business ethics.

To learn more about how we collect, process, and store your personal data, please review our Privacy Notice: https://www.trinetix.com/corporate-policies/privacy-notice

Title: Naturwissenschaftler (m/w/d)
Description:
MORE THAN A JOB -

COME TO THE LABS OF EXCELLENCE!



Wir sind Deutschlands führende Umweltanalytiker für chemische und mikrobiologische Untersuchungen von Wasser, Luft und Feststoffen. Davon profitieren Behörden, Gewerbe und Dienstleister und wir helfen so, unsere (Um)Welt ein bisschen besser zu machen.



Die Eurofins Umwelt besticht durch Nachhaltigkeit sowohl in den Unternehmenswerten als auch im Produkt und wächst weiter. Möchtest Du Deine Ideen und Engagement in unserem modernen Laborunternehmen verwirklichen? Dann bist Du bei uns genau richtig.



Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams der Umweltmykologie GmbH suchen wir Dich zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als Naturwissenschaftler (m/w/d) in Vollzeit und unbefristeter Festanstellung an unserem Standort in Berlin-Steglitz.





Stellenbeschreibung


Als Naturwissenschaftler (m/w/d) betreust Du die Kunden sowohl fachlich als auch administrativ bei der korrekten und termingerechten Abwicklung ihrer Aufträge über die gesamte Prozesskette.
Hier fällt unter anderem die Erstellung von Prüfberichten und Angeboten in Deinen Aufgabenbereich.
Als Schnittstelle zwischen den Kunden, der Probenregistrierung und dem Labor bist Du der fachliche Ansprechpartner (m/w/d) bezüglich Fragestellungen zum Produktportfolio der Eurofins Umwelt sowie zu gesetzlichen Verordnungen und Anforderungen.
Bei Deinen Bestandskunden baust Du feste Kundenbeziehungen auf und bist das Gesicht der Eurofins in Richtung unserer Kundschaft.
Interne Projekte und Forschungsvorhaben sind für Dich die Möglichkeit Dich aktiv in die Gestaltung des Unternehmens mit einzubringen.
Du arbeitest in einem dynamischen Team mit dem gemeinsamen Ziel unsere Produkte erlebbar zu machen und den Kundenservice ständig zu verbessern.


Qualifikationen


Bestenfalls hast Du Dein Studium im naturwissenschaftlichen Bereich (z. B. Biologie, Geologie, Chemie), andernfalls eine Ausbildung als z. B. Baubiologe (m/w/d) oder ein Studium in einem anderen Fachgebiet abgeschlossen.
Du hast Interesse an dem Themenbereich Feuchteschäden, Baukonstruktion und Gesundheit und die Bereitschaft zur intensiven Einarbeitung in diese Arbeitsbereiche.
Erste Berufserfahrungen in der Umweltanalytik, vor allem im Bereich Baustoffkunde, Baukonstruktion und Bauphysik sowie Mikrobiologie sind von Vorteil, aber kein Muss.
Erfahrung in der Angebotserstellung sowie gute MS-Office-Kenntnisse sprechen ebenfalls für Dich.
Die deutsche Sprache beherrscht Du sehr gut in Wort und Schrift.
Du bist eine zuverlässige, strukturierte und teamorientierte Persönlichkeit mit schneller Auffassungsgabe und lösungsorientierter Herangehensweise und zeichnest Dich Durch Deine selbstständige und kundenorientierte Arbeitsweise aus.


Zusätzliche Informationen



Freue Dich auf



Die Chance auf eine langfristige und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit in einem globalen Unternehmen, wo kein Tag ist wie der andere.
Eine offene Unternehmenskultur mit flachen Hierarchien und kurzen Entscheidungswegen sowie ein Team, in dem Kollegialität großgeschrieben wird.
Eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance mit 30 Urlaubstagen im Jahr und einer 38,5 Stundenwoche mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten.
Eine intensive und individuell auf Dich zugeschnittene Einarbeitung in unterschiedlichen Arbeitsfeldern (u. a. Kundenbetreuung, Berichtswesen).
Eine verantwortungsvolle und anwendungsorientierte Aufgabe in einem motivierenden Arbeitsumfeld.
Regelmäßige Evaluationsgespräche, um Deine fachliche und persönliche Entwicklung gezielt zu fördern.
Die Möglichkeit, eigene Ideen zu kommunizieren und bei deren Umsetzung mitzuwirken.
Mitarbeit an Forschungsprojekten und Veröffentlichungen.
Besuch von fachspezifischen Tagungen, bei dem ein direkter Kontakt mit unseren bundesweit aktiven Kunden möglich ist.
Interne und externe Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten, wie z. B. Hygieneinspektion von Raumlufttechnischen Anlagen.
Attraktive Vorzüge wie JobRad, Corporate Benefits und betriebliche Altersvorsorge exklusiv für Eurofins-Mitarbeiter.
Gemeinschaft wird bei uns großgeschrieben: Freu Dich auf regelmäßige Mitarbeiterevents wie Sommerfeste und Weihnachtsfeiern.



Unternehmensbeschreibung



Die Kreativität unserer Mitarbeiter (m/w/d) bringt das Unternehmen voran. Wir suchen Persönlichkeiten, die die Zukunft mitgestalten und etwas bewegen. Kunden­orientierung aus Überzeugung und ein verantwortungsbewusster Umgang mit natürlichen Ressourcen bringen uns dabei unserem Ziel täglich näher, weltweiter Marktführer in allen Segmenten zu sein.



In nur 35 Jahren ist Eurofins von einem Labor in Nantes, Frankreich, auf über 63.000 Mitarbeitende in einem Netzwerk von mehr als 950 unabhängigen Unternehmen in 60 Ländern mit mehr als 900 Laboratorien gewachsen. Eurofins bietet ein Portfolio von mehr als 200.000 Analysemethoden zur Bewertung der Sicherheit, Identität, Zusammensetzung, Authentizität, Herkunft, Rückverfolgbarkeit und Reinheit von biologischen Substanzen und Produkten sowie innovative Dienstleistungen im Bereich der klinischen Diagnostik als einer der weltweit führenden, aufstrebenden Anbieter von spezialisierten klinischen Diagnosetests.



Im Jahr 2024 erzielte Eurofins einen Gesamtumsatz von 6,95 Milliarden Euro und zählt in den letzten 20 Jahren zu einer der Aktien mit der besten Wertentwicklung in Europa.



Wir bieten Dir nach einer entsprechenden Einarbeitungszeit eine abwechslungsreiche und attraktive Tätigkeit in einem erfolgreichen internationalen Unternehmen.



Wenn wir Dein Interesse geweckt haben, dann bewirb Dich bitte über unser Online-Formular mit der Schaltfläche "Jetzt bewerben!". Bitte beachte, dass wir der Umwelt zuliebe ausschließlich digitale Bewerbungen entgegennehmen.



Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!


Show more

Title: ML Engineer - with Data Science Background (d/f/m)
Description:
Personio's intelligent HR platform helps small and medium-sized organizations unlock the power of people by making complicated, time-consuming tasks simple and efficient. Our growing team of 1,800+ Personios across Europe and the US are building user-friendly products that delight our 14,000+ customers and their 1.5 million employees. Ready to make an impact from day one?

ML Engineer - with Data Science Background (d/f/m)

Personio is growing rapidly. With that growth comes the increasing demand for machine learning solutions that don’t just provide insights, but power real, production-ready products.

As an ML Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping Personio’s AI and ML capabilities. We are looking for someone who can build high-quality ML systems with the rigor of an engineer, while also bringing the curiosity and experimentation mindset of a data scientist. Your work will involve productionizing ML and generative AI models, ensuring they deliver measurable business impact.

You’ll join our central AI/ML function, collaborating across departments to drive innovation and enable AI-driven decision-making at scale.

What You’ll Do


Design, develop, and deploy robust machine learning and AI systems for a range of business use cases, including generative AI.
Build and operationalize ML solutions to address business challenges and unlock new opportunities.
Integrate ML and AI models into production systems, ensuring scalability, reliability, and maintainability.
Deploy and monitor MLOps workflows, including CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, monitoring, and model versioning.
Leverage cloud platforms (AWS + Snowflake) and ML infrastructure (e.g., SageMaker, feature stores) for scalable deployment.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Product, Sales, Marketing, etc.) to deliver AI-driven features and insights.
Ensure all ML/AI solutions adhere to best practices in data privacy, security, and ethical standards.
Contribute to a culture of technical excellence, knowledge sharing, and continuous learning.


What You Need To Succeed


University degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
5+ years’ experience building and deploying production-grade machine learning models.
Strong software engineering mindset — ability to write clean, reusable, and scalable code in Python.
Experience integrating ML/AI models into production software systems.
Solid understanding of MLOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and automated testing frameworks.
Background in data science: comfort with experimentation, A/B testing, and measuring ROI/impact of ML projects (not just accuracy).
Hands-on experience with ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face).
Experience with NLP or generative AI techniques is a strong plus. Familiarity with cloud-based ML infrastructure (AWS, Snowflake, SageMaker, etc.).


Why this role?


Join a newly created AI sprint team focused exclusively on delivering LLM and ML-powered projects with real business impact.
Work in a lean, well-supported environment (dedicated TPM, analytics engineer, and data platform support — no need to build ingestion pipelines).
Full ownership of end-to-end ML delivery: from prototype to production.
Exposure to high-impact use cases (e.g., automating marketing campaigns, personalization engines) backed by executive sponsorship.
A chance to bridge the gap between data science and engineering, bringing cutting-edge AI into production at scale.


Why Personio?

We’re one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech companies, building the leading HR platform for SMEs. With over 15,000 customers, offices across Europe, and strong backing from top-tier investors, Personio is scaling fast — and AI is a critical enabler of that growth.

We’re also proud of our culture:


A diverse, inclusive workplace where your voice matters.
Competitive compensation, equity, and benefits. 28 days’ vacation, plus an additional day after two and four years.
Flexible, office-led but remote-friendly working with the option for international work weeks.
Mental health support, family leave, Impact Days, sabbaticals, and regular team events.
Show more

  • Solid understanding of MLOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and automated testing frameworks.
  • Background in data science: comfort with experimentation, A/B testing, and measuring ROI/impact of ML projects (not just accuracy).
  • Hands-on experience with ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face).
  • Experience with NLP or generative AI techniques is a strong plus. Familiarity with cloud-based ML infrastructure (AWS, Snowflake, SageMaker, etc.).

Why this role?

  • Join a newly created AI sprint team focused exclusively on delivering LLM and ML-powered projects with real business impact.
  • Work in a lean, well-supported environment (dedicated TPM, analytics engineer, and data platform support — no need to build ingestion pipelines).
  • Full ownership of end-to-end ML delivery: from prototype to production.
  • Exposure to high-impact use cases (e.g., automating marketing campaigns, personalization engines) backed by executive sponsorship.
  • A chance to bridge the gap between data science and engineering, bringing cutting-edge AI into production at scale.

Why Personio?

We’re one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech companies, building the leading HR platform for SMEs. With over 15,000 customers, offices across Europe, and strong backing from top-tier investors, Personio is scaling fast — and AI is a critical enabler of that growth.

We’re also proud of our culture:

  • A diverse, inclusive workplace where your voice matters.
  • Competitive compensation, equity, and benefits. 28 days’ vacation, plus an additional day after two and four years.
  • Flexible, office-led but remote-friendly working with the option for international work weeks.
  • Mental health support, family leave, Impact Days, sabbaticals, and regular team events.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
BEST WORK OF YOUR CAREER




Trade Republic is the largest savings platform in Europe - we operate in 17 countries, serving +10 million customers who trusted us with over 100B in assets. But we’re striving for more.

We have a bold mission to empower everyone to build wealth with easy, safe, and free access to financial systems. You will have the opportunity to grow your career by collaborating with a team of outstanding talents and state of the art technology to build a lasting, positive future for millions.




WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING




Our Operations Platform team leads the development of automated workflows and tools for our Operations and Customer Support staff to achieve an amazing customer experience.

To achieve this, we recognise that data isn't just a resource - it's a cornerstone. In this role you will:




Plan and execute the roadmap for your services together with the team
Play a pivotal role in designing the architecture of your data products, ensuring they are scalable, robust, and synergistic with our existing platforms
Research, build, test and deploy models - this is where you will spend most of your time. With a focus on team ownership, this gives a lot of time for our developers and data scientists to actually work technically instead of with process
Once deployed, you will continue to oversee your products, monitoring their performance metrics and making data-driven adjustments as needed to optimise result




WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR




at least 5 years of end-to-end data science and software engineering experience, preferably in a dynamic environment with a modern tech stack
Experience working in Operations, specifically significant experience in customer service automations
Experience with applying a wide variety of machine learning techniques to business problems, particularly with tabular and natural language data
Strong command of SQL, Python together with its scientific stack (numpy, pandas, matplotlib, scikit-learn)
Good understanding of Software Engineering practices (e.g. test-driven development, OOP, CI/CD, etc.) and experience with productionizing ML products
Recent hands-on experience in deploying and maintaining an AI agent/workflow powered by LLMs, using both low level SDKs (openai, anthropic, google-genai,..) and prompt engineering frameworks (llama-index, langchain, dspy, ..)
General understanding of LLMOps principles, for evaluating, testing, versioning and experimenting prompts in staging and production (langsmith, langfuse, arize-phoenix, lunary, ..)




WHY YOU SHOULD APPLY NOW




Our culture rewards ownership, excellence, and high energy. We care deeply about outcomes and hold each other accountable - we’re here to win and fix one of the largest challenges Europeans face - closing the pension gap and democratising wealth. If this gets you fired up, reach out!

Show more

Title: Principal/Staff Data Scientist - Economics
Description:
As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

Join us in our Vendor Data team, where you will design, build, and implement advanced monetization and pricing models that shape the economic success of hundreds of thousands of restaurants and local businesses globally.

Your contributions will unlock new revenue streams, optimise vendor monetisation, and guide data-driven decision-making – having a decisive impact on our global bottom-line. Furthermore, you will support our restaurant partners to provide affordable meals to more than 10 million people every day across 60+ countries.

We’re looking for a scientifically rigorous, yet strongly pragmatic and commercially-minded data scientist who thrives on complexity, impact, and autonomy. If you are a go-getter who is excited about high-performance environments and combines intellectual sharpness, strong commercial acumen, and a positive attitude, we would be excited to get to know you.

What you’ll do


Lead the development of econometric and machine learning models to optimise take rate, pricing strategies, and vendor monetisation, working alongside top commercial leaders and technical experts.
Design, run, analyse, and improve experiments and A/B tests to validate your hypotheses in real-world settings.
Present research and recommendations to senior executives, shaping company-wide strategy to enable our 1m+ restaurant partners across the globe to grow while monetizing our services sustainably.
Partner closely with the Commercial, Product, and Data Engineering teams to embed advanced modelling and experimental insights into pricing, incentive, and vendor engagement decisions, while regularly delivering recommendations and insights to senior business leaders.
Join a team with a proven track record in scaling billion-dollar tech business from scratch.


Qualifications


Ph.D. in Economics or a similar field with an emphasis on quantitative research methods including forecasting, causal inference, machine learning and experiment design.
5+ years of experience in data science roles, ideally in Revenue Management, Pricing, or Monetization Analytics in e-commerce, marketplaces, fintech, or AdTech
Experience with marketplace pricing dynamics, multi-modal optimisation, and revenue forecasting models, plus deep understanding of economic concepts such as price elasticity, contribution margins, ROI metrics, rebate mechanics, and segmentation analyses
You're a fast learner, critical thinker, and creative problem solver who strives for excellence - and you’re hungry to take on complex, ambiguous challenges
Willingness to take responsibility on high-stakes, company-defining projects with substantial financial impact and eagerness to deliver clear recommendations to top management
Passion for data, with creative problem-solving abilities and an eye for detail
Proficiency in Python and/or R, and SQL (preferably with BigQuery), with experience in statistical modelling and data visualisation (Tableau or similar) with continuous iteration
Excellent English communication skills, both written and oral, and able to explain complex modelling outcomes to both technical and non-technical audiences in a concise way


Additional Information

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.
Show more

Title: Founder's Associate: AI and Sales
Description:
🚀 Bring Agentic AI to an Age-Old Industry — with Inca




We’re hiring a Founder’s Associate – AI & Sales (m/f/d) who will become the right hand of our CEO and help build INCA from the ground up. You’ll play a key role in defining our strategy, creating scalable structures, and driving our commercial success.




This is not a classic operations or sales role — you’ll operate at the intersection of AI innovation, company building, and business development. From designing sales strategies to engaging with VCs and building the operational backbone of our fast-scaling company — you’ll do it all.




Who We Are




We are Inca – a venture-backed startup on a mission to automate insurance claims through Agentic AI.





🚀 We bring Agentic AI to insurance industry with a no-bullshit approach — delivering cutting-edge results, where others overpromise.


🔥 The market is on fire: we’re flooded with inbound interest from insurers eager to transform their claims processes.


🧠 Our team combines former BCG Project Leaders, industry- and AI-experts. Together, we’re redefining how insurances are operating in Europe.


💥 We're backed by top-tier VCs from one of the most competitive InsurTech Pre-Seed rounds in Europe



Tasks



Act as the CEO’s right hand, helping drive all strategic and operational topics


Build the structures, processes, and culture of a rapidly scaling AI company


Develop and execute our sales and go-to-market strategy: from conceptualizing our approach, to first pitch, to closing deals


Help manage relationships with VCs and investors, help steer the next funding rounds


Work hand in hand with our AI product team to align commercial priorities with cutting-edge product development


Shape and evolve our storytelling and messaging for clients, partners, and investors


Own high-impact, high-autonomy strategic projects



Requirements



Drive. Drive. Drive. You take charge, think clearly, and execute with sharpness and commitment.


1–2+ years experience at a Tier A company: VC-backed startup, top consulting firm, investment bank, VC fund, or similar


Structured, analytical mindset: you solve problems and build systems


Entrepreneurial energy: you love ambiguity, building from scratch, and making things happen


Strong communication skills: you pitch, negotiate, and win people over


Curiosity and passion for AI, automation, and transforming traditional industries


Nice to have: Early-stage startup or company building experience; Exposure to AI, SaaS, or B2B enterprise sales; Experience working with investors or C-level stakeholders



Benefits


Why INCA?





🤖 Real AI, real impact: We don’t play AI theater. We build agentic systems that actually work — and transform an industry that’s been asleep for decades.


💥 No bullshit culture: No politics, no empty promises — just clarity, ownership, and results.


🧠 Once-in-a-lifetime learning opportunity: Grow with a team of top-tier BCG Project Leaders and AI experts. Full exposure to what it takes to create and scale a venture-backed company.


💸 Highly competitive salary + meaningful equity: You’re not just an employee — you’re an owner.


🌍 Berlin-based, hybrid-friendly, regular offsites


🌴 30 vacation days + 2 weeks work-from-anywhere


⚡ High-speed environment: We move fast, we execute — and we’re here to win
Show more

Title: Remote Nebenjob: Studenten gesucht / (m/w/d)
Description:
Hi! Du bist Student*in? Du suchst einen Nebenjob? Wir von Nachhilfeunterricht suchen Tutoren (m/w/d) in den verschiedensten Fächern. Die Schulen und Vorlesungen gehen wieder los und die Nachfrage nach Nachhilfe und Privatunterricht steigt. Arbeite, wo und wann du möchtest, gib Online- oder Präsenzunterricht und verdiene zwischen 20-35€ pro Stunde.Wähle aus über 300 Fächern:-Naturwissenschaftlicher Unterricht: Mathematik, Biologie, Chemie, Physik, Technik, Statistik...-Sprachen: Deutsch, Englisch, Spanisch, Französisch, Portugiesisch, Italienisch, Chinesisch, Japanisch...-Computer- und Technikunterricht-Workshops, Kurse und andere Themen!

Unterrichte Schüler in ganz Deutschland online von zu Hause aus oder in deiner Nähe und teile dir deine Arbeitszeiten flexibel ein

Wähle die Themen von denen du selbst begeistert bist und biete deinen Unterricht auf der Grundlage deiner Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen an


Keine vorherige Lehrerfahrung erforderlich.
Gute Kenntnisse in dem zu unterrichtenden Fach.
Selbstständige und strukturierte Arbeitsweise.
Keine vorherige Lehrerfahrung erforderlich.
Gute Kenntnisse in dem zu unterrichtenden Fach.
Selbstständige und strukturierte Arbeitsweise.


Um Teil unserer Nachhilfelehrer*innen zu werden, ist es nicht nötig, deinen Lebenslauf oder Leistungsnachweise einzureichen. Wir freuen uns auf dich!

Über uns:Wir sind eines der führenden Nachhilfe- und Unterrichtsportale in Europa. Unsere Lehrer*innen unterstützen Schüler*innen in verschiedenen Schulfächern, Sprachen sowie technischen und künstlerischen Disziplinen. Die Plattform ermöglicht Lehrer*innen das Hochladen von Inseraten für Nachhilfe- oder Privatunterricht und bringt so Schüler*innen und geprüfte Nachhilfelehrer*innen zusammen.

Title: Naturwissenschaftler/Lebensmittelchemiker als Berater (m/w/d)
Description:
Naturwissenschaftler/Lebensmittelchemiker (m/w/d) als Berater

In Voll- oder Teilzeit (ab 30 Stunden/Woche)

Die analyze & realize GmbH (a&r) ist ein führendes Auftragsforschungs- und Beratungsunternehmen für Hersteller und Vertreiber von pharmazeutischen und diätetischen Produkten sowie Medizinprodukten. Speziell im Bereich Natural Health & Consumer Healthcare führen wir nationale und internationale klinische Studien durch und beraten Unternehmen regulatorisch, wissenschaftlich und im strategischem Innovationsmanagement.

Zur Verstärkung unseres Consulting & Strategic Innovation Teams in Berlin suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen Naturwissenschaftler/Lebensmittelchemiker (m/w/d) als Berater.

Aufgabenschwerpunkte


Wissenschaftliche und regulatorische Beratung zu Lebensmitteln (inkl. Nahrungsergänzungsmitteln und Lebensmitteln für bestimmte Gruppen), Lebensmittelzutaten, pflanzlichen Arzneimitteln und substanzbasierten Medizinprodukten
Bewertung von Qualität, Wirksamkeit, Sicherheit und regulatorischer Konformität der oben genannten Produktkategorien
Unterstützung bei der Erlangung der Marktzulassung von pflanzlichen Arzneimitteln (z.B. THMPs), Lebensmitteln (z.B. Novel Foods) und stoffgebundenen Medizinprodukten
Erstellung und Einreichung von Zulassungsanträgen (z.B. CTDs, Novel-Food-Dossiers, technische Dokumentation)
Präsentation von Projektergebnissen und Vertretung unseres Unternehmens auf internationalen Konferenzen und in Kundengesprächen


Anforderungen


Abgeschlossenes naturwissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium (Master/PhD) (z.B. Lebensmittelchemie, Pharmazeutische Wissenschaften, Biotechnologie, Biochemie oder Biologie), vorzugsweise mit erster Berufserfahrung
Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch
Projektmanagement-Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, Projekte im Zeit- und Budgetrahmen abzuwickeln
Grundlegende Kenntnisse der EU-Verordnungen zu Lebensmitteln, Arzneimitteln und Medizinprodukte-Zertifizierungen wären von Vorteil; “2. Staatsexamen” in Lebensmittelchemie wäre ein Vorteil aber nicht zwingend
Affinität zu Consumer Healthcare und Naturprodukten
Erfahrung im Verfassen von wissenschaftlichen Publikationen und Dokumentationen
Selbstmotivierter Teamplayer mit starker Serviceorientierung


Wir Bieten


Leistungsgerechte, Faire Vergütung
Die Möglichkeit, Ihr Aufgabengebiet selbstständig aktiv zu gestalten
Gleitzeit und flexible Arbeitszeiten
30 Urlaubstage bei 40 Wochenstunden
Übernahme Kosten BVG Ticket (Bereich AB)
Vermögenswirksame Leistungen
Lage mit guter Verkehrsanbindung


Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen


Aussagekräftiges Anschreiben mit Erläuterung Ihrer Motivation
Tabellarischer Lebenslauf
Relevante Zeugnisse (einschl. Hochschulreifezeugnis)
Mögliches Eintrittsdatum
Anzahl der Stunden, die Sie arbeiten möchten (zwischen 30 und 40 Stunden pro Woche)
Gehaltsvorstellung


Ansprechpartnerin: Anna Lubicz-Stojanowska

E-Mail: HResources@a-r.com
Show more

  • Präsentation von Projektergebnissen und Vertretung unseres Unternehmens auf internationalen Konferenzen und in Kundengesprächen

Anforderungen

  • Abgeschlossenes naturwissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium (Master/PhD) (z.B. Lebensmittelchemie, Pharmazeutische Wissenschaften, Biotechnologie, Biochemie oder Biologie), vorzugsweise mit erster Berufserfahrung
  • Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch
  • Projektmanagement-Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, Projekte im Zeit- und Budgetrahmen abzuwickeln
  • Grundlegende Kenntnisse der EU-Verordnungen zu Lebensmitteln, Arzneimitteln und Medizinprodukte-Zertifizierungen wären von Vorteil; “2. Staatsexamen” in Lebensmittelchemie wäre ein Vorteil aber nicht zwingend
  • Affinität zu Consumer Healthcare und Naturprodukten
  • Erfahrung im Verfassen von wissenschaftlichen Publikationen und Dokumentationen
  • Selbstmotivierter Teamplayer mit starker Serviceorientierung

Wir Bieten

  • Leistungsgerechte, Faire Vergütung
  • Die Möglichkeit, Ihr Aufgabengebiet selbstständig aktiv zu gestalten
  • Gleitzeit und flexible Arbeitszeiten
  • 30 Urlaubstage bei 40 Wochenstunden
  • Übernahme Kosten BVG Ticket (Bereich AB)
  • Vermögenswirksame Leistungen
  • Lage mit guter Verkehrsanbindung

Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen

  • Aussagekräftiges Anschreiben mit Erläuterung Ihrer Motivation
  • Tabellarischer Lebenslauf
  • Relevante Zeugnisse (einschl. Hochschulreifezeugnis)
  • Mögliches Eintrittsdatum
  • Anzahl der Stunden, die Sie arbeiten möchten (zwischen 30 und 40 Stunden pro Woche)
  • Gehaltsvorstellung

Ansprechpartnerin: Anna Lubicz-Stojanowska

E-Mail: HResources@a-r.com

Title: (Junior) Wirtschaftsredakteur (w/m/d)
Description:
⌚ Vollzeit oder Teilzeit mit mindestens 30h/Woche

🏠 Berlin oder remote

Finanzfluss – Wir machen Menschen zu finanziellen Selbstentscheidern.

Wir glauben, dass Geld gut ist. Du auch? Dann werde Teil unserer Community. Diese besteht aus finanzinteressierten Menschen und erreicht jeden Monat über unsere Website, Social Media, den Newsletter und Podcast ein Millionenpublikum. Zusammen mit unserer Community entstehen ständig neue Ideen, die wir mit großer Freude umsetzen.

Unsere Mission ist es, Menschen das erforderliche Wissen einfach zugänglich zu machen und sie damit zu ermutigen, ihre finanzielle Zukunft aktiv selbst zu gestalten.

Über uns

Dein Impact

Wir bauen ein neues Redaktionsteam für den Bereich „Wirtschaft und News“ auf. Als Teil dieses neuen Teams bist du maßgeblich am Auf- und Ausbau eines wochentäglichen Formats beteiligt, welches unsere Community multiperspektivisch auf relevante nationale und internationale Nachrichten aus den Bereichen Wirtschaft, Politik und Finanzen brieft.

Deine Aufgaben

li]:w-full" data-v-1b638a16="">


Recherche und Aufbereitung nationaler und internationaler Inhalte für ein wochentägliches News-Format (Podcast) mit den Themenschwerpunkten Wirtschaft, Politik und Finanzen.
Skripten verschiedener Podcast-Elemente.
Rekrutierung spannender Interview-Gäste; Briefing (technisch und inhaltlich) der Gäste.
Qualitätskontrolle der Episoden.
Aufbereitung des Contents für verschiedene Plattformen in enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem Socialteam.
Nutzung von KI-Tools für effiziente Content-Erstellung (du übernimmst die Qualität, die KI die Quantität).
Community-Management zur Steigerung des Engagements.


Deine Skills

li]:w-full" data-v-1b638a16="">


Erste Erfahrung in einer Wirtschaftsredaktion (abgeschlossenes Volontariat an einer Journalistenschule mit Schwerpunkt Wirtschaft).
Hohe Qualitätsstandards: Du kannst Inhalte faktisch korrekt und einfach verständlich aufbereiten und einordnen.
Bereitschaft, Verantwortung für Inhalte zu übernehmen.
Du kannst gut unter Zeitdruck und mit Deadlines arbeiten.
Optional: Du hast bereits Erfahrung vor dem Mikro.


Wir bieten dir

li]:w-full" data-v-1b638a16="">


Unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis mit einem kompetitiven Gehalt.
Mit unserem Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsprogramm (VSOP) partizipierst du an unserem Unternehmenserfolg.
Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten in einem stark wachsenden und profitablen Start-up.
Ein modernes Büro mit Home-Office-Flexibilität oder alternativ 100% remote work.
Ein zielstrebiges Team und eine großartige Community.
Aufbau/Erweiterung deiner KI-Skills in einem redaktionellen Umfeld.


🤩

Interessiert?

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Jetzt bewerben
Show more
